summary: Deploying a live website and setting up a custom domain for it.

existing_features.title:
Update the Publishing & Share page to support custom domains by displaying and copying a configurable canonical public URL.

- Read the canonical URL from `import.meta.env.VITE_PUBLIC_URL`.
- If `VITE_PUBLIC_URL` is empty/undefined, fall back to `window.location.origin`.
- Show both:
  1) the current deployed URL (`window.location.origin`) and
  2) the canonical public URL (from `VITE_PUBLIC_URL` fallback logic)
- Provide copy-to-clipboard buttons for each URL.
- Ensure all user-facing text is in English.

Make sitemap generation use the configurable public base URL so `frontend/public/sitemap.xml` contains `<loc>` entries that match `VITE_PUBLIC_URL` when configured.

- Ensure the `frontend/scripts/generate-sitemap.mjs` output is the source of truth.
- Update the repo’s committed `frontend/public/sitemap.xml` to match the current `VITE_PUBLIC_URL` behavior (i.e., not hardcoded to `https://managing-emerald-pk9-draft.caffeine.xyz`).

Ensure SEO metadata uses the configurable canonical public URL via `VITE_PUBLIC_URL`.

- Keep `frontend/index.html` using `%VITE_PUBLIC_URL%` for `og:url`, JSON-LD `url`, and JSON-LD `potentialAction.target`.
- Preserve the existing runtime fallback behavior when the env var is not set.

Add/confirm plain-English “Custom Domain” guidance for end users explaining that domain registration and DNS setup must be performed at their registrar, and that they should set `VITE_PUBLIC_URL` and redeploy to update SEO and sitemap.

new_feature_requests.summary: Set up a custom domain for the live website (e.g., yourname.com)

projectName: Enable custom domain setup guidance and configurable canonical URL for sharing + SEO
